intro: Arnebia transcaspica, commonly known as the Transcaspian bloodroot, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to red flowers during the summer months. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
